column4: hey there -- anyone who can answer a quick config question (gnome)
i would like to be able to type in addresses in an "address bar" in the file manager -- can't figure out how to do it -- too much clicking! any thoughts?
windows has a nice hybrid where i can click when i want and type in address locations as needed -- is this possible in ubuntu?
in edgy, just click the leftmost button
o.k. so edit --> preferences
no on the adress toolbar
*address
yeah -- i don't see it -- what check box is it? (i did look into this before asking :))
yes -- i believe it is dapper
sorry guys, which panel, i can't get it to work
got it
config editor is up
looking jrib . . .
yes -- i have it
o.k. so i have swapped out the path bar for a typed in location bar
let me try that
sweet it's there already . . . no restart required (For the program) how is that??
o.k. jrib -- one more for you: any way to emulate "windows + D" to minimize everything with the click of a button?
keyboard
pronoob -- no, i like clicking and typing (otherwise i am hitting 'ls' like a mad-man)
ctrl-alt-D should be bound to that already no?
o.k jrib will try
-- yep -- you got it!!! sweet!
